description: Zakat is the third pillar of Islam. It is an obligatory act of charity where Muslims must give a fixed portion (2.5%) of their accumulated wealth annually to the needy. It purifies wealth, supports the community, and promotes social justice.

importance.text: And establish prayer and give zakah, and whatever good you put forward for yourselves – you will find it with Allah.
Take, [O Muhammad], from their wealth a charity by which you purify them and cause them increase, and invoke [Allah’s blessings] upon them.

who_pays_zakat: Muslim adults who are sane and free
Must meet or exceed the Nisab (minimum amount of wealth)
Must possess this wealth for a full lunar year

nisab_threshold.value: Or equivalent in cash or trade goods

rate: 2.5% of total zakatable assets after one lunar year
zakatable_assets: Cash in hand and bank accounts
eligible_recipients: Zakat workers (those employed to collect it)
Those whose hearts are to be reconciled
In the cause of Allah (e.g., da’wah, defense)

hadiths.text: Islam is built upon five pillars: testimony, prayer, zakat, fasting, and pilgrimage.

Whoever is made wealthy by Allah and does not pay the Zakat of his wealth, then on the Day of Resurrection it will be made like a bald-headed poisonous male snake with two black spots over the eyes...

benefits: Bridges the gap between rich and poor
recommended_etiquettes: Pay Zakat as soon as it's due
